item.title: After Live-Service Reality Check, PlayStation Is Rethinking Risk
item.description:
PlayStation is rethinking its approach to risk following its recent reality check in the live-service segment, a senior company official has said. Though the newly confirmed strategy shift is multi-faceted, it largely centers on Sony changing the way it manages PlayStation studios.

Launched in late August 2024 and permanently shut down just two weeks later, Firewalk Studios' Concord is the most high-profile failure of Sony's live-service foray, which started under the leadership of former SIE CEO Jim Ryan. However, it is far from the only one, with previous reports suggesting PlayStation canceled at least 11 live-service games between 2022 and early 2025. While some of those projects are said to have been in an early stage of development and therefore did not cost much, several are believed to have been in the works for years, consequently burning through significant funds before being shelved. This was the case with The Last of Us Online , which started as a multiplayer mode for the 2020 The Last of Us 2 before being canceled at the tail end of 2023.

Sony Rethinking the PlayStation Studio Model

Faced with these setbacks, the group is rethinking the PlayStation studio model. That's according to Sony Interactive Entertainment co-CEO Hermen Hulst, who said as much in a recent interview with the Financial Times. "I don’t want teams to always play it safe, but I would like for us, when we fail, to fail early and cheaply," the industry veteran explained.

PlayStation Studios Are Now More Cooperative

To that end, PlayStation studios are now subject to more frequent and varied testing procedures, and encouraged to share development insights across teams, something that they haven't consistently done in the past. The goal, Hulst says, is to preserve creative independence while ensuring teams are not unknowingly duplicating efforts or rushing headfirst into costly mistakes. While each of Sony's 20 PlayStation studios remains largely autonomous, the changes are geared toward nurturing a stronger culture of internal coordination and shared accountability.

From Concord to Controlled Growth

Concord 's failure has become a cautionary tale within Sony, reportedly costing the company as much as $400 million, a figure that includes the estimated costs of acquiring Firewalk Studios, which has since been shuttered. In a recent Q&A session with investors, Hulst was adamant that Sony will not "make the same mistakes again" following Concord . His recent comments to the Financial Times echo that sentiment.

I don’t want teams to always play it safe, but I would like for us, when we fail, to fail early and cheaply.

The new approach will result in a reduced output, but should also minimize risk. Long-term, Sony is hoping its first-party studios will start contributing a greater percentage of the group's overall revenue, which amounted to $31.7 billion in the fiscal year ending March 2025.

item.title: Upcoming Games With Ridiculous Settings
item.description:
Summary

  • Unique settings in upcoming RPGs include a levitating cube, a shattered London, and a psychedelic dreamscape.
  • Games like Time Takers and High On Life 2 offer distinct environments blending past, present, and future concepts.
  • Denshattack! and Into the Unwell aim to captivate players with vibrant dystopian worlds and cartoonish, eerie surroundings.

The future is bright for the video game world, and one of the most important aspects of any new release is having a unique and impressive setting to captivate players before the game even launches. And with new technology comes new limits to be broken, allowing modern games to go even further in terms of environmental design and heightened setting complexity.

There are groundbreaking sci-fi planets, quaint fantasy lands, technological masterpieces, and so much more for players to look forward to, regardless of whether they enjoy intense first-person shooters or slower-burning RPG adventures.

The Cube

A Giant Floating Battleground

The Cube
Action
Adventure
Shooter
RPG
MMO
Systems
Developer(s)
Mundfish

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

The Cube comes from the creators of Atomic Heart and looks to be an interesting and modern addition to the RPG genre. The entire game takes place on a levitating cube, covered in various environments from snowy forests to run-down villages, which shift and turn as the entire map changes shape.

The game aims to combine aspects from extraction shooters, such as Tarkov , with more in-depth RPG mechanics, providing players with numerous opportunities to grow stronger and build out their character however they choose.

Tides Of Annihilation

Modern London Meets Otherworldly Invasion

Tides of Annihilation
Action
Adventure
Systems
ESRB
Rating Pending

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Eclipse Glow Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

Tides of Annihilation is an ambitious ARPG that sends players to the shattered city of London, full of magic and giant creatures that tower over the skyscrapers with an imposing yet enticing aura.

The actual environment looks even more stunning than the gameplay, with iconic buildings being torn to shreds and beams of light extending high into the clouds. It will take quite some time for players to fully take in the surroundings before heading off into the fight, but when they do, they will be greeted with fast and flashy combat to fully pull them into the world.

Call Of Duty: Black Ops 7

A New Campaign Taking Players To New Heights

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
Action
FPS
Sci-Fi
Systems
Released
November 14, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Treyarch, Raven Software
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Black Ops 7 takes the COD franchise in a brand new direction, blending real-world locations like Los Angeles with psychedelic dreamscapes that defy logic and transport players to the darkest parts of the mind and soul.

The environments look to level up the concept of verticality, with roads extending above buildings and platforms floating beyond cities in ways that can only exist in an artificial space. It's a refreshing change from the grounded settings of the past and will certainly give players quite the thrill ride when it releases in just a few months.

Keeper

Journey Across Several Whimsical Realms

Keeper
Adventure
Puzzle
Fantasy
Systems
Released
October 17, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Double Fine
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Keeper has the kind of beauty that can only come from true childhood wonder. The world is full of wonky and disproportionate structures and creatures, all within a charming and wonderful environment that oozes with happiness.

Players waddle across watery coastlines and journey up into the mountains in search of the center of the island. With such a unique art style and gameplay approach, adventure lovers should definitely add Keeper to their wishlist to get them ready for a truly wonderful expedition.

Denshattack!

Hypnotic And Full Of Color

Denshattack!
Platformer
Action
Systems
Released
2026

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Denshattack! is a stylish 3D platformer that sees players gliding across cities, deserts, and mountains in the midst of a vibrant dystopian world. The game brings with it a lot of scale, as each stage sends players flying into the skies and deep into the oceans below.

Combining skateboard-style tricks with fast-paced boss battles, players can expect an adrenaline-filled ride that removes all barriers and continues to deliver surprises from start to finish, both in the environment and story itself.

Time Takers

Blending Past, Present, And Future

Time Takers
Third-Person Shooter
Action
Systems
Developer(s)
Mistil Games

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Time Takers is an upcoming free-to-play, third-person team shooter where time itself is the most valuable resource. Players can jump into a match as a character from different times, and battle their way across maps that blend modern landmarks with ancient structures of all kinds.

The maps are large and diverse, offering both visual spectacles and interesting combat arenas for teams to traverse. This means that not only is the game distinctive in terms of aesthetics and setting, but it also has plenty of ways for players to express their skills in terms of movement and map knowledge.

High On Life 2

Returning To The Comedic Alien Universe

High on Life 2
Action
Adventure
FPS
Systems
Developer(s)
Squanch Games

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

High On Life 2 sends players back to the hilarious yet brutal sci-fi world from the original, only this time with more brutality and more absurdity in the world than the environment before.

Players can blast their way through nightclubs, futuristic cities, underground bunkers, and even space itself, as the series once again demonstrates that limits are meant to be broken and that any setting imaginable is possible with the right mindset.

Into The Unwell

Cartoonish Surroundings Full Of Pain And Suffering

Into the Unwell
Action
Roguelike
Systems
Developer(s)
She Was Such A Good Horse

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Into the Unwell is an interesting roguelike that sends players into a hellish and miserable world inspired by classic cartoons from the past. Every platform and stage is comprised of trash and other discarded objects, giving it a unique roughness that extends to the gameplay itself.

The Unwell itself is a strange and peculiar world that suffocates players with its gloomy atmosphere and depressing skylines, ensuring that players are fully immersed in this descent into the inner psyche that tests more than just reflexes and skill.

item.title: Valve’s Deadlock Sees Major Player Count Spike
item.description:
Valve's in-development MOBA Deadlock is currently enjoying a major player count spike, bringing the game back to levels not seen in almost a year. The Deadlock player count increase follows the recent release of a few new heroes in the game, with the promise of more to come.

Initial testing for Deadlock began just over a year ago. Its existence initially wasn't acknowledged by Valve, despite it being fairly common knowledge that it was in the works. The early momentum of the game saw it hit a peak of over 171,000 concurrent players on Steam, although its player count has dwindled in the year since. To this day, the only way to get into the Deadlock playtest is to be invited by a Steam friend, which may prove prohibitive to some players.

Deadlock Currently Has Its Highest Player Count in Almost a Year

However, interest in Valve's next multiplayer MOBA is still there, as shown by recent SteamDB numbers. Over the last few days, Deadlock has hit a peak player count of 47,111, which is impressive given the fact that the game has stabilized at between 10,000 and 20,000 over the last few months. It's still a far cry from the 171,490 all-time peak player count, but it's a good sign that Deadlock won't be dead on arrival further down the line.

Deadlock 's sudden spike in players is no accident. On August 18, Valve emerged from the shadows to confirm that six new Deadlock heroes were being rolled out in the near-future. At the time of writing, just three of the six have been released: Mina, Billy, and The Doorman. The last of the trio has caught the attention of many gamers in particular, with his ability to open doors on walls (portals, some would say) reminding players of another popular Valve franchise. The release of these characters has already been enough for fans to give Deadlock another chance, but whether they'll stick around is another matter.

After something of a hiatus in the mid-to-late 2010s, it seems that Valve's interest in fully-fledged games development is ramping up again. Counter-Strike 2 was released in 2023 and continues to get frequent updates, the long-rumored Half-Life 3 occasionally gets positive development updates from in-the-know leakers, and Deadlock represents the studio trying something completely new. Sure, not everything will work, but the gaming industry is undeniably better when Valve is in the business of actually making and releasing new games.

item.title: Upcoming Steam ARPG is Like Diablo 4 in First-Person
item.description:
Upcoming Steam action RPG Daimon Blades is set to launch into Early Access on September 3, and the game has a strong " Diablo 4 in first-person" vibe. This exciting Steam title looks to combine the all-action demon killing and dungeon crawling gameplay of the Diablo series with the replayability of a roguelike, all from a fresh first-person perspective.

The best Steam hidden gems are often those that look to combine various well-worn genres to create a brand-new experience. These games from smaller developers often don't have to be as risk-averse as larger titles, which naturally leads to some interesting concepts. They don't always work, but there are multiple examples of indie games that have taken chances and been all the better for it. The hope is that Daimon Blades can join this club.

Daimon Blades is An Action RPG With a First-Person Twist

Streum On Studio's first-person hack-and-slash ARPG was only announced a few days ago, but it is already set to launch on Steam in Early Access on September 3. As per the description, Daimon Blades is a "brutal first person slasher that combines the depth of action RPGs and replayability of roguelites," in which players must "contain the rising tides of daimonic incursions, and face relentless abominations while descending deeper and deeper into the Daimon realm." Boasting "20 diverse enemy families," "4 lethal boss encounters" and RPG customization with loot, crafting, and resources, Daimon Blades also offers "9 biomes with unlimited variations for unique levels every playthrough." There's a lot to like here.

On the surface, it shares a lot of DNA with the Diablo series. Even aesthetically, a lot of the environments and enemies look like they could be pulled from Blizzard's iconic action RPG franchise. It even has four-player co-op, allowing players to enjoy the chaos alongside a few friends. But still, Daimon Blades retains an identity of its own. The entire thing takes place in first-person, which will come largely as a change of pace for fans of ARPGs like Diablo and Path of Exile . This, combined with how it plans to blend the genre with roguelike mechanics, makes Daimon Blades a very interesting prospect.

Streum On Studios' most recent game was Necromunda: Hired Gun , which received a Top Critic Average of just 58 on review aggregator site OpenCritic back in 2021. If Daimon Blades is to make a splash and become one of the best ARPGs on the market, it will need to represent a significant improvement over the developer's last effort. Gamers could get some indication of whether that will be the case when it releases in Early Access on September 3.

item.title: Starfield on Switch 2 is Already Listed by an Online Retailer
item.description:
A new listing for Starfield on Nintendo Switch 2 has appeared on an online retail site, adding some fire to the rumors about the outer space action-RPG's jump to Nintendo's new hybrid console. Nintendo has yet to officially confirm whether Starfield is planned for a Switch 2 release, but the idea of a possible port seems to have a lot of support from fans.

Bethesda released Starfield in September 2023, attempting to add a new open-world RPG that could rival its other two big RPG franchises, Fallout and The Elder Scrolls , while giving players an entire galaxy of more than 1,000 planets and moons to explore. The initial launch, exclusive to Xbox Series X|S and PC, didn't see it reach those heights, and while professional critics heaped a lot of praise on the game, players gave it a much more lukewarm reception. Starfield currently sits at Mixed reviews on Steam, with a 57 percent approval rating, and a slightly more positive Player Score of 70 on OpenCritic.

Online Store Lists Starfield for Nintendo Switch 2

Despite not meeting expectations, many gamers have been patiently waiting for Starfield to make the jump to other platforms. Most recently, credible leaker NateTheHate made a mid-August post on Twitter claiming that Starfield will be coming to Nintendo Switch 2 sometime in 2026. There has been no official public confirmation from Nintendo or Bethesda that this release is planned, but that hasn't stopped online retailer Instant Gaming from listing Starfield under its recently added games for Switch 2. The store page for Starfield follows the rumors, listing it for release on Switch 2 at an unspecified date in 2026, but it does not currently have an option for pre-order listed.

The Switch 2 is just the latest console to have rumors of a Starfield port emerge. Rumors have been swirling for most of the year about Starfield 's potential debut on PlayStation 5, and recent developments have made a deal between Microsoft and Sony seem a little more likely. An early August release from MP1st, citing an unnamed source, reported that a PS5 port of Starfield was planned for release in Spring 2026.

While both sets of rumors are still awaiting confirmation from an official source, reports state that the PS5 release could be arriving alongside Starfield 's rumored second expansion. So far, the only expansion DLC released for Starfield has been Shattered Space, which came out at the end of September 2024 and expanded on the backstory of the House Va'ruun faction. Like the base game, the first expansion faced heavy criticism, with players singling out its repetitive gameplay and poor storytelling, but lead designer Emil Pagliarulo has publicly stood by both the base game and Shattered Space, showing Bethesda's commitment to keeping Starfield growing.

Starfield is the first new universe in 25 years from Bethesda Game Studios, the award-winning creators of The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim and Fallout 4. In this next generation role-playing game set amongst the stars, create any character you want and explore with unparalleled freedom as you embark on an epic journey to answer humanity’s greatest mystery.
The year is 2330. Humanity has ventured beyond our solar system, settling new planets, and living as a spacefaring people. From humble beginnings as a space miner, you will join Constellation – the last group of space explorers seeking rare artifacts throughout the galaxy – and navigate the vast expanse of the Settled Systems in Bethesda Game Studios’ biggest and most ambitious game.
